perturbation.original_text:
(c) “Company” means the Joint Venture entity which will be registered and incorporated in a Canadian jurisdiction with its operating name as
Novo Earth Therapeutics Inc.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) “Company” means the Joint Venture entity which will be operated as a division of NVOS and will not be registered or incorporated as a separate legal entity.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the Joint Venture as a separate incorporated entity, whereas the modified text states that it will not be registered or incorporated, directly contradicting the initial definition. This introduces uncertainty about the legal structure and liability of the joint venture under Canadian corporate law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Canadian corporate law regarding the establishment and operation of joint ventures and separate legal entities.

perturbation.original_text:
9.3
To remunerate HGF on the basis of thirty percent (30%) of net Company income basis on an annual basis commencing 12 months after the
first full 12-month revenue period.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.3
To remunerate HGF at NVOS's discretion, potentially up to thirty percent (30%) of net Company income, contingent on NVOS's overall profitability.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the Joint Venture as a separate incorporated entity, whereas the modified text states that it will not be registered or incorporated, directly contradicting the initial definition. This introduces uncertainty about the legal structure and liability of the joint venture under Canadian corporate law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding definite terms and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
12.1
The distribution will be based on NVOS audited review and will be made within three months of annual considerations on the basis of a
seventy percent (70%) of net profit to NVOS and thirty percent (30%) of net profit to HGF.
perturbation.changed_text:
12.1
The distribution will be based on NVOS's assessment of available funds, which may or may not align with audited net profit, and will be distributed at NVOS's convenience.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a clear distribution based on audited net profit with a fixed percentage split. The modified text makes the distribution discretionary based on NVOS's assessment and convenience, contradicting the originally agreed-upon terms and creating uncertainty regarding the distribution process. Also the changed text removes the clear split between both entities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding definite terms and enforceability.
